articles.title: Speeding Up the JS Ecosystem: The Barrel File Debacle
articles.description: Marvin continues his tour through the world of JavaScript performance fixes with a look at how some innocent looking code can make tools run slower than they should. Test runners and many import cycle detection tools are most affected.
articles.author: Marvin Hagemeister

articles.title: üåä ¬†Building a Water/Fluid Simulation in JavaScript
articles.description: Hard to explain, but a lot of thought and care has gone into this tutorial of sorts. The live demos are nice, too. Uses p5.js behind the scenes.
articles.author: Kenichi Yoneda

articles.title: Angular and Qwik's Creator on How JS Frameworks Handle Reactivity
articles.description: A summary of Mi≈°ko Hevery‚Äôs keynote from the International JavaScript Conference looking at reactivity across the major frameworks.
articles.author: Loraine Lawson (The New Stack)

articles.title: A Web Server ‚ÄòHello World‚Äô Benchmark: Go vs Node vs Nim vs Bun
articles.description: The standard disclaimer applies: benchmarks are difficult and don‚Äôt always measure what you should care about.
articles.author: Daniel Lemire

articles.title: Evidence: Reports Synced to Your Data with SQL and Markdown
articles.description: An open source, code-based alternative to drag-and-drop business intelligence tools. ‚ñ∂Ô∏è This nine minute screencast does a good job at showing off what it can do.
articles.author: Evidence

articles.title: Payload 2.0: A Headless CMS Platform Built on Node
articles.description: A Node-based headless CMS providing an app framework-like experience, including a customizable React-based admin system, GraphQL or REST APIs, flexible auth and file upload systems, etc. v2.0 introduces Postgres support (in addition to MongoDB), Vite support, and a new rich text editor. GitHub repo.
articles.author: James Mikrut

articles.title: Visual Studio Code Extension Tester v5.10
articles.description: A framework for simulating user interactions with VS Code and its extensions via Selenium Webdriver.
articles.author: Red Hat

articles.title: audioMotion-analyzer: Real-Time Audio Spectrum Analyzer
articles.description: A high-resolution real-time audio spectrum analyzer JavaScript module with no dependencies. Gives a single or dual channel view. (Note the AGPL license.) GitHub repo.
articles.author: Henrique Avila Vianna

articles.description: Electron 27 ‚Äì The cross-platform desktop app toolkit gains Chromium 118, Node.js 18.17.1, and V8 11.8, but loses macOS 10.13/14 support.
Fresh 1.5 ‚Äì A Deno-native framework for building full-stack webapps. v1.5 adds support for partials ‚Äì the ability to update a portion of an existing page.
Parcel 2.10 ‚Äì The zero-config build tool gets some serious performance improvements (7x faster on large projects). Devon Govett wrote üê¶ a Twitter thread explaining how.
Bun 1.0.5 ‚Äì Mostly bug fixes and gentle improvements for the performance-oriented JS runtime. No HTTP/2 yet, but it's just around the corner..
Solid 1.8 ‚Äì Declarative and performant reactivity for building UIs.

articles.title: When to Nest CSS
articles.description: CSS nesting is great, but Scott notes it should be used with some caution. The complex answer given here to the question of just when to deploy it is to ‚Äúnest pseudo-selectors, parent modifiers, media queries, and selectors that don‚Äôt work without nesting‚Äù.
articles.author: Scott Vandehey

articles.title: Five Best Practices for Preventing Chaos in Tailwind¬†CSS
articles.description: Tailwind CSS is a very popular CSS framework, but Nina notes how using it without proper caution can add ‚Äúmayhem to your code‚Äù. Here, she shares some best practices to ensure you ‚Äòstay aloft‚Äô when using it.
articles.author: Nina Torgunakova

articles.title: Demystifying WCAG 2.2
articles.description: The W3C recently released the newest version of the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines. Nathan breaks down the headlines from WCAG 2.2 for us. Adrian Roselli brings together some other good related resources and links here.
articles.author: Nathan Schmidt

articles.title: Chrome's New Origin Trial for Fullscreen Popup Windows
articles.description: There‚Äôs now a new origin trial available in Chrome for opening popup windows in fullscreen mode with just one step.
articles.author: Thomas Steiner (Chrome)

articles.title: The Future of CSS: Easy Light-Dark Mode Color Switching with light-dark()
articles.description: Bramus shares a look at this new utility function (part of the draft CSS Color Module Level 5) that either computes to the first color if the used color scheme is light or unknown, or to the second color if the used color scheme is dark.
articles.author: Bramus Van Damme

articles.title: Being Picky About a CSS Reset for Fun & Pleasure
articles.description: We recently shared Andy Bell‚Äôs new take on a modern CSS reset, now Chris Coyier has decided to go through it line-by-line and offer his subjective take on it.
articles.author: Chris Coyier

articles.title: Can Browser Choice Screens Be Effective?
articles.description: Some research (admittedly from Firefox maker Mozilla themselves) that highlights the critical importance design plays when making an effective 'browser choice' screen, a feature set to be ‚Äòback on the menu‚Äô following EU legislation set to come into force next year.
articles.author: Mozilla Research

articles.title: Safari's Simplified Responsive Design Mode
articles.description: The responsive design testing tools in Apple‚Äôs browser have been updated.
articles.author: Jon Davis (WebKit)

articles.title: ‚ñ∂¬†¬†The Psychology of Web Performance
articles.description: A near hour-long talk highlighting some research that digs into the neuroscience of speed/performance along with studies that connect the dots between site speed and user experience.
articles.author: Tammy Everts

articles.title: CDNs: Speed Up Performance by Reducing Latency
articles.description: This post is from a few months ago now, but we missed it at the time, so maybe you did too. It covers what CDNs are, how they work, and why you need one. Austin also shows us how to connect one such CDN from Akamai to Object Storage.
articles.author: Austin Gil

articles.title: autocomp.js: A Tiny JavaScript Autocomplete Library
articles.description: A really simple solution that can easily be styled with CSS and weighs in at ~800 bytes minified and gzipped. Try out two variations on this demo page.
articles.author: Kailash Nadh

articles.title: Lite YouTube Embed 0.3: A Faster Youtube Embed
articles.description: Faster than the official one, at least. v0.3 implements reliable autoplay. There‚Äôs a live demo here.
articles.author: Paul Irish

articles.title: Durves: A Tool for Creating and Exporting Dot Patterns for Graphic Designers
articles.description: This lets you generate PNG or SVG pattern of points through various properties (matrix, dot radius, etc.), to generate a base grid for creating a graphic design project, UI/UX, etc.
articles.author: Filipe Esteves

articles.title: Gradient Designer: A Visual Tool to Create/Customize Gradients Using Modern Features
articles.description: This tool lets you choose modern color spaces (sRGB, Oklab, etc.) after which you can export the gradient as CSS, SVG, JSON, or JavaScript.
articles.author: Aarni Koskela

articles.title: CSS Box Shadows Generator: An Online Tool to Edit and Generate Code for Layered Box Shadows
articles.author: CSS Box Shadows Generator

articles.description: Passkeys are now the default option across personal Google Accounts.
Cloudflare, Google, Microsoft, & Amazon all say they successfully mitigated what some are calling the "biggest DDoS layer 7 attacks" recorded.
A twenty-two year old tooltip bug in Firefox has just been fixed.
Did you know a CSS property like border-top-right-radius can ‚ñ∂Ô∏è take more than one value?
This gallery brings together examples of good website footers.
